text: welcome to this short demo on how to
enable Amazon Elastic file system
infrequent access storage class with
just few clicks
by using lifecycle management policy
Amazon EFS file system have two storage
classes available the standard storage
class which is used to store frequently
accessed files the infrequent excess
storage class also referred as EFS ie is
a lower-cost storage class that's
designed for storing long lived in
frequently accessed files EFS is storage
is compatible with all EFS features and
is available in all EWS regions where
Amazon EFS is available EFS I is a cost
optimized for the files not accessed
every day with the storage prices up to
92% lower compared to EFS standard to
load the data into EFS I simply an ebony
FS lifecycle management from the EFS
console EFS IA is suitable for most
general purpose and FS based file shares
here I'm selecting the default settings
to quickly create the basic file system
the policy has six different options to
choose from
depending upon your use case by default
it is set to none
this policy enables the capability that
monitors your access patterns and moves
files across to EFS storage classes
according to the policy you choose in
this demo I will choose 7 days since
last access which means after seven days
if the file does not exist it will be
moved from standard storage to
infrequent access storage class for more
information click on learn more link
shown here on the console let's continue
to create this file system with the
default settings
after a few seconds the file system is
created scroll down to the other details
and you see the configured lifecycle
policy you can also update or delete the
policy on the existing file systems as
well as shown here in summary to enable
EFS iya storage class on new file system
or existing file system simply create a
lifecycle management file access policy
using AWS CNI API or EFS management
console files not access according to
the age of policy will be automatically
moved to the FSIA storage class thank
you for watching
